column1: French: Je viens de rentrer. = English: I just got in. ### French: mais accompagne moi ! = English:
column2: But do join me!
column3: I just got in. ### But come with me!

column1: French: Qu'est-ce qui vous a donné envie de mettre vos chaussures dans le four ? = English: What made you want to put your shoes in the oven? ### French: et préparer ensemble une expérience de chimie à présenter par oral aux autres élèves = English:
column2: And together prepare a chemistry experiment to present orally to the other students.
column3: and prepare a chemistry experiment to present to the other students

column1: French: je file et je reviens avec ce que je trouve! = English: I'll dash off and I'll be back with what I find! ### French: Alors commençons par des questions simples. = English:
column2: So let's start with simple questions.
column3: So let's start with some simple questions.

column1: French: Si on doit rester ici encore longtemps, vous pouvez travailler. = English: If we have to stay here any longer, you could work. ### French: de plus, nous étions trop cher = English:
column2: And we were too expensive.
column3: Also, we were too expensive.

column1: English: Great. = French: Super. ### French: On sera réduits en miettes, à plusieurs kilomètres sous l'eau. = English:
column2: We'll be ripped to shreds, several kilometres underwater.
column3: We'll be smashed into tiny pieces, hundreds of meters below water.

column1: French: Je n'ai malheureusement pas compris la dernière phrase, pouvez-vous reformuler ? = English: Unfortunately I didn't understand the last sentence. Could you reformulate? ### French: Je dois te laisser pour l'instant, mais merci pour tous tes conseils! = English:
column2: I have to go now, but thank you for your advice!
column3: I have to leave you for now, but thank you for all your advice!

column1: French: restons ici près de la piscine alors = English: Let's stay here next to the pool then. ### French: Et les repas sont assez bons. = English:
column2: And the meals are quite good.
column3: And the food is quite good.

column1: French: Enfin! = English: Anyway! ### French: Désolée une erreur = English:
column2: Sorry a mistake.
column3: Sorry for the mistake.

column1: French: Vous êtes sûre que cet ascenseur est correctement entretenu? = English: Are you sure this lift is maintained correctly? ### French: Et surtout, cette relation vous faisait du mal. = English:
column2: And most importantly, the relationship was hurting you.
column3: And most importantly, this relationship hurt you.

column1: English: Something sweet, and something colourful would be nice! = French: Quelque chose de doux et quelque chose de coloré serait très bien ! ### French: Il n'y a pas beaucoup de lumière, et, de dos, vos cheveux longs m'ont induit en erreur. = English:
column2: There isn't much light in here, and from behind your long hair threw me off.
column3: There is not much light, and your long hair confused me.

column1: English: I'm trying to have a relaxing time here and I'd prefer not to be disturbed. = French: J'essaie de me détendre ici et je préférerais ne pas être dérangé. ### French: Ah, il faudra que tu me le présentes! = English:
column2: Ah, you must introduce him to me!
column3: Oh, you have to introduce him to me!

column1: English: what about dolphins? = French: Et les dauphins ? ### French: Cela m'occupera l'esprit = English:
column2: It'll help take my mind off it.
column3: And the dolphins? ### That'll keep me busy.

column1: French: C'est votre chouchou! = English: He's your favourite. ### French: Si on doit rester ici encore longtemps, vous pouvez travailler. = English:
column2: If we have to stay here any longer, you could work.
column3: If we have to stay here for a long time, you can work.

column1: French: cool = English: Cool. ### French: Juste en face il y a le cabinet du Dr Jekyll, c'est un excellent diététicien. = English:
column2: Just opposite is Dr. Jekyll's surgery. He's an excellent nutritionist.
column3: Just across the street is Dr Jekyll's office, he is a very good dietitian.

column1: French: Ou revenions sur nos pas tout simplement ? = English: Or simply retracing our steps? ### French: Je vous que vous avez votre ordinateur avec vous, c'est parfait. = English:
column2: You've got your computer with you, I see. It's perfect.
column3: I'm sure you have your laptop with you, that's perfect.

column1: French: D'accord on se voit demain ! = English: Ok see you tomorrow! ### French: Même si ça tombe mal, il vaut mieux ça plutôt que ce soit l'ascenseur qui tombe ! = English:
column2: Even if it falls at a bad time, better that than the lift falling!
column3: Even if it falls, it's better than the elevator falling!

column1: French: Tu as bien du mérite de me supporter ! = English: Credit to you for putting up with me! ### French: Je ne suis pas sûr que ces canards vont aimer notre vieux pain = English:
column2: I'm not sure these ducks are going to like our old bread.
column3: I'm not sure these turkeys will like our old bread

column1: French: Courage, les secours arrivent ! = English: Hang in there, help's arriving! ### French: C'est vraiment un bel endroit. = English:
column2: It's really a beautiful place.
column3: It's really a beautiful place.

column1: English: But you never had problems with the old neighbours then? = French: Mais alors vous n'avez jamais eu de problème avec vos anciens voisins ? ### French: Je me demande ce qui a bien pu se passer, nous nous sommes peut-être trompées sur la commande .... = English:
column2: I wonder what could have happened. Perhaps we got the order wrong...
column3: I wonder what could have happened, maybe we misunderstood the order...

column1: French: Et votre dissertation doit être la meilleure que vous ayez jamais écrite... = English: And your essay must be the best you've ever written... ### French: D'accord. = English:
column2: Ok.
column3: Yes.

column1: French: C'est vrai, on pourrait. = English: We could, you're right. ### French: Comptez-vous prendre le volant en sortant ? = English:
column2: Are you planning on driving when you leave here?
column3: Maybe, you're right. ### Do you plan to drive when you get out?
